briefdescription.para: Vector of links.

detaileddescription.para: For each link its index indicates its location in this vector

briefdescription.para: Vector of joints.

detaileddescription.para: For each joint its index indicates its location in this vector

briefdescription.para: Vector of additional frames.

detaileddescription.para: The element additionalFrames[frameOffset] will be the link_H_frame transform of the frame with FrameIndex getNrOfLinks() + frameOffset .

briefdescription.para: Vector of link indices corresponding to an additional frame.

detaileddescription.para: The element additionalFrameNames[frameOffset] will be the link_H_frame transform of the frame with FrameIndex getNrOfLinks() + frameOffset .

briefdescription.para: Vector of link names, matches the index of each link to its name.
Vector of joint names, matches the index of each joint to its name.
Vector of additional frame names.

detaileddescription.para: The element frameNames[frameOffset] will be the name of the frame with FrameIndex getNrOfLinks() + frameOffset .

briefdescription.para: Adjacency lists: match each link index to a list of its neighbors, and the joint connecting to them.
Most data structures are not undirected, so we store the original root of the tree, to provide a default root for Traversal generation.
Cache number of position coordinaties of the model.

detaileddescription.para: If all joints are 0 or 1 dofs, this is equal to nrOfDOFs.

briefdescription.para: Cached number of (internal) DOFs of the model.

detaileddescription.para: This is just the sum of all the getNrOfDOFs of the joint in the model.

briefdescription.para: Solid shapes used for visualization.
Solid shapes used for collision checking.
Copy the structure of the model from another instance of a model.
Destroy the object, properly deallocating memory.
Costructor.
Copy costructor.
Copy operator.
Copy the model.

detaileddescription.para: Get a copy of the model.

briefdescription.para: Destructor.
Get the number of links in the model.
Get the name of a link given its index, or an LINK_INVALID_NAME string if linkIndex < 0 or >= getNrOfLinks()
Check if a given LinkIndex is valid.

detaileddescription.para: A link index is valid if is different from LINK_INVALID_INDEX and 0 =< index < getNrOfLinks()-1

simplesect.para: true if the index is valid, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get number of joints in the model.
Get the name of a joint given its index, or an JOINT_INVALID_NAME if linkIndex < 0 or >= getNrOfLinks()
Get the total mass of the robot.
Get the index of a joint, given a jointName.

detaileddescription.para: If the jointName is not found in the model, return JOINT_INVALID_INDEX .

briefdescription.para: Check if a given JointIndex is valid.

detaileddescription.para: A joint index is valid if is different from JOINT_INVALID_INDEX and 0 =< index < getNrOfJoints()-1

simplesect.para: true if the index is valid, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Check if a name is already used for a link in the model.

simplesect.para: true if a name is used by a link in a model, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Check if a name is already used for a joint in the model.

simplesect.para: true if a name is used by a joint in a model, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Check if a name is already used for a frame in the model.

simplesect.para: this function will check the name of the links and the names of the additional frames.
true if a name is used by a frame in a model, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Add a joint to the model.

detaileddescription.para:
The two links to which the joint is connected are specified in the joint itself, throught the appropriate methods.
the JointIndex of the added joint, or JOINT_INVALID_INDEX if there was an error in adding the joint.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &link1, const std::string &link2, const std::string &jointName, IJointConstPtr joint)
memberdef.name: addJoint

briefdescription.para: Add a joint to the model, and specify the two links that are connected by the specified joints.

detaileddescription.para:
The setAttachedLinks of the passed joint is called appropriately, to ensure consistency in the model.
the JointIndex of the added joint, or JOINT_INVALID_INDEX if there was an error in adding the joint.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &existingLink, const std::string &jointName, IJointConstPtr joint, const std::string &newLinkName, Link &newLink)
memberdef.name: addJointAndLink

briefdescription.para: Add a joint to the model, and add also a link.

detaileddescription.para:
The added joints connects an existing link of the model to the newly added link. The setAttachedLinks of the passed joint is called appropriately, to ensure consistency in the model.
the JointIndex of the added joint, or JOINT_INVALID_INDEX if there was an error in adding the joint.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &existingJoint, const std::string &unmovableLink, const Transform &_unmovableLink_X_newLink, const std::string &jointName, IJointConstPtr joint, const std::string &newLinkName, Link &newLink)
memberdef.name: insertLinkToExistingJointAndAddJointForDisplacedLink

briefdescription.para: Displace a link by inserting a new link and a new joint.

detaileddescription.para:
Displace a link by replacing it with a new link in the existing joint and insert new joint between the new link and the displaced link. Inputs:
existingJoint
is where the new link will be inserted.
unmovableLink
is the link that was previously connected to the displaced link by the existingJoint.
_unmovable_X_newLink
is the transformation matrix from the unmovableLink to the new Link.
jointName
is the name of the new joint.
joint
is the new joint connecting the new link and the link that was displaced.
newLinkName
is the name of the new link.
newLink
is the new link that will be attached to the unmovable link using the existingJoint. The setAttachedLinks of the new joint and the existing joint are edited appropriately, to ensure consistency in the model.
the JointIndex of the added joint, or JOINT_INVALID_INDEX if there was an error in adding the joint.

briefdescription.para: Get the dimension of the vector used to parametrize the positions of the joints of the robot.

detaileddescription.para: This number can be obtained by summing the getNrOfPosCoords of all the joints of the model.

simplesect.para: This is not including the 6 degrees of freedom of the base.

briefdescription.para: Get the number of degrees of freedom of the joint of the robot.

detaileddescription.para: This number can be obtained by summing the getNrOfDOFs of all the joints of the model.

simplesect.para: This is not including the 6 degrees of freedom of the base.

briefdescription.para: Get the number of frames in the model.

simplesect.para: this will return the sum of the number of link (as each link has an attached frame) and the total number of additional frames.
the number of frames in the model.

briefdescription.para: Add an additional frame to a link.

simplesect.para: This function has signature different from addJoint/addLink because the FrameIndex of the additional frame are invalidated at each call to the addLink. So we don't return the FrameIndex in this function, as the model construction should be completed before that FrameIndex are stored.

parameterdescription.para: the link to which attach the additional frame.
the name of the frame added to the model.
the pose of added frame with respect to the link main frame, expressed with a transform with: refFrame: the main link frame frame: the added frame

simplesect.para: true if all went well, false if an error occured.

briefdescription.para: Get the name of a frame given its index.

parameterdescription.para: the index of the frame whose name is requested.

simplesect.para: the name of a frame given its index, or a FRAME_INVALID_NAME string if frameIndex < 0 or >= getNrOfFrames()

briefdescription.para: Get the index of a frame given its name.

parameterdescription.para: the name of the frame for which the index is requested.

simplesect.para: the index of the frame, of FRAME_INVALID_INDEX if frameName is not not a frame name.

briefdescription.para: Check if a given FrameIndex is valid.

detaileddescription.para: A frame index is valid if is different from FRAME_INVALID_INDEX and 0 =< index < getNrOfFrames()-1

simplesect.para: true if the index is valid, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the tranform of the frame with respect to the main frame of the link, returned as link_H_frame tranform with refFrame : the link main frame and frame : the frame with index frameIndex .

parameterdescription.para: the index of the frame for which transform is requested.

simplesect.para: the link_H_frame transform, or an identity tranform if frameIndex < 0 or frameIndex >= getNrOfFrames .

briefdescription.para: Get the link at which the frame with index frameIndex is attached.
Get the additional frames of a specified link.

simplesect.para: The vector of returned frame index is ordered according to the frame index.
This method searches linearly over all the frames.

parameterdescription.para: a LinkIndex of the specified link,
a vector of FrameIndex of the frame indeces attached to the specified link index,

simplesect.para: true if the specified link is a valid link, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the nr of neighbors of a given link.

memberdef.argsstring: (const LinkIndex link, unsigned int neighborIndex) const
memberdef.name: getNeighbor

briefdescription.para: Get the neighbor of a link.

detaileddescription.para: neighborIndex should be >= 0 and <= getNrOfNeighbors(link)

briefdescription.para: Set the default base link, used for generation of the default traversal.
Get the default base link, used for generation of the default traversal.

detaileddescription.para: If no link are present in model, returns LINK_INVALID_INDEX. If setDefaultBaseLink was never called but at least a link has been added to the model, returns 0 (i.e. the index of the first link added to the model.

simplesect.para: index of the default base link, if valid

briefdescription.para: Compute a Traversal of all the links in the Model, doing a Depth First Search starting at the default base.

simplesect.para: The traversal computed with this function contains pointers to the joints and links present in this model. Whenever these pointers are invalidated, for example because a link or a joint is added or the model is copied, the traversal need to be recomputed.
this function works only on Models without cycles.

parameterdescription.para: traversal of all links in the model

simplesect.para: true if all went well, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Compute a Traversal of all the links in the Model, doing a Depth First Search starting at the given traversalBase.

simplesect.para: The traversal computed with this function contains pointers to the joints and links present in this model. Whenever these pointers are invalidated, for example because a link or a joint is added or the model is copied, the traversal need to be recomputed.
this function works only on Models without cycles.

parameterdescription.para: traversal of all links in the model

simplesect.para: true if all went well, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Get the inertial parameters of the links of the model in vector forms.

detaileddescription.para: This methods gets the inertial parameters (mass, center of mass, 3D inertia matrix) of the links of the robot.

The output vector of inertial parameters must have 10*getNrOfLinks() elements, each 10 elements subvector corresponds to the inertial parameters of one link, following the serialization induced by the link indices (link 0 corresponds to elements 0-9, link 1 to 10-19, etc).
The mapping between the SpatialInertia class and the Vector10 elements is the one defined in SpatialInertia::asVector() method.

simplesect.para: true if all went well, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Update the inertial parameters of the links of the model.

detaileddescription.para: This methods modifies the inertial parameters (mass, center of mass, 3D inertia matrix) of the links of the robot.

The input vector of inertial parameters must have 10*getNrOfLinks() elements, each 10 elements subvector corresponds to the inertial parameters of one link, following the serialization induced by the link indices (link 0 corresponds to elements 0-9, link 1 to 10-19, etc).
The mapping between the SpatialInertia class and the Vector10 elements is the one defined in SpatialInertia::asVector() method.

simplesect.para: For efficency reason, inertial parameters are not checked for full physical consistency before being update.
true if all went well, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the ModelSolidShapes meant for visualization.

simplesect.para: a reference to ModelSolidShapes meant for visualization.

briefdescription.para: Get the ModelSolidShapes meant for visualization (const version)

simplesect.para: a reference to ModelSolidShapes meant for visualization.

briefdescription.para: Get the ModelSolidShapes meant for collision checking.

simplesect.para: a reference to ModelSolidShapes meant for visualization.

briefdescription.para: Get the ModelSolidShapes meant for collision checking (const version)

simplesect.para: a reference to ModelSolidShapes meant for visualization.

briefdescription.para: Get a printable representation of the Model.

detaileddescription.para: Useful for debugging.

briefdescription.para: Class that represents a generic multibody model.

detaileddescription.para: A model is composed by rigid bodies (i.e. links) connected by joints. Each joint can have from 0 to 6 degrees of freedom.
Each link has a "link frame" rigidly attached to it. Additionally, other rigidly attachable frames can be defined for each link.

The model contains also a serialization for the different elements, i.e. a function between:
joint names and the integers 0..getNrOfJoints()-1
dof names and the integers 0..getNrOfDOFs()-1
link names and the integers 0..getNrOfLinks()-1
frame names and the integers 0..getNrOfFrames()-1

For simplicity, these mappings are build when building the model. In particular the link and joint indices are assigned when the links and joint are added to the model using the addLink and addJoint methods.

The DOF indices are also assigned when the joint is added to the model with the addJoint method. For example if a model is composed only of 0 or 1 DOF joints and the 1 DOFs joints are added before the 0 DOFs then the joint index and dof index for 1 DOF joints will be coincident (this is how the URDF parser is actually implemented). For this reason the current implementation does not have a concept of DOF explicit identifier, i.e. a getDOFName(DOFIndex dofIndex) method does not exist.

The frame indices between 0 and getNrOfLinks()-1 are always assigned to the "main" link frame of the link with the same index. The frame indices between getNrOfLinks() and getNrOfFrames()-1 are assigned when the additional frame is added to the model with the addAdditionalFrameToLink call. All the additional frame indices are incremented by 1 whenever a new link is added, to ensure that its "link frame" has a frame index in the 0...getNrOfLinks()-1 range.
